alert.note: Alert for Butler; Hamilton (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 5:57PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EASTERN FRANKLIN, NORTHEASTERN DEARBORN, NORTHWESTERN HAMILTON AND SOUTHWESTERN BUTLER COUNTIES THROUGH 630 PM EDT... At 556 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Brookville, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Oxford, Harrison, Brookville, Bright, Ross, Reily, New Haven, St. Leon, Scipio, West Harrison, Cedar Grove, Mount Carmel, Mounds State Recreation Area, Okeana, Rockdale, Mixersville, Mcgonigle, Sharptown and St. Charles. This includes the following Interstates... I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 166 and 171. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 1. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
